ili.lights
Class Light

java.lang.Object
  ili.lights.Light
Direct Known Subclasses:
CCTLight, ColorLight
public class Light
extends java.lang.Object

This is a general light object which contains a light state (on/off) and an intensity, and intensity range and can be used to create representations of light sources

Constructor Summary
Light()
          Creates a standard light object with default settings intensity at 255, range from 0-255.
Light(int intensity)
          Creates a new light object with the intensity set to the specified value.
 
Method Summary

          Adds an object to listen to this light

          Returns this light source representation as an XMLElement in the format
 int getIntensity()
          Returns the current intensity of this light source.
 int getLightID()
          Returns the light identifier of this light source
 int getMaxIntensity()
          Returns the maximum value of this light source (standard 255)
 int getMinIntensity()
          Returns the minimum value of this light source's intensity (standard 0)

setLightID

public void setLightID(int lightID)
Sets the identifier of this light source to the specified value. Automatically sets this light source to also use the light id, when requested.

Parameters:
lightID -

getLightID

public int getLightID()
Returns the light identifier of this light source

Returns:
int

enableLightID

public void enableLightID()
Enable the use of the light identifier. Can be useful when you have a single object with multiple light sources. This allows you to distinguish among light sources in one object.

disableLightID

public void disableLightID()
Disable the use of the light identifier.

setIntensity

public boolean setIntensity(float intensity)
Sets the intensity to the specified value if it is between the minimum and maximum range. Automatically casts the specified value to an integer value.

Parameters:
intensity -
Returns:
boolean

setIntensity

public boolean setIntensity(int intensity)
Sets the intensity to the specified value if it is between the minimum and maximum range. Light source automatically throws an event to all listeners.

Parameters:
intensity - (int)
Returns:
boolean

setIntensity

public boolean setIntensity(int intensity,
                            boolean fireEvent)
Sets the intensity to the specified value if it is between the minimum and maximum range. Specify whether you would like the light source to throw an event.

Parameters:
intensity - (int)
fireEvent - (boolean)

setState

public boolean setState(boolean state)
Set the state of this light source (on/off) to the specified value (true/false). Fires an even to all listeners and returns the updated state. Returns the new state of the light source.

Parameters:
state -
fireEvent -
Returns:
boolean

setState

public boolean setState(boolean state,
                        boolean fireEvent)
Set the state of this light source (on/off) to the specified value (true/false). Fires an even to all listeners and returns the updated state if specified in the second argument Returns the new state of the light source.

Parameters:
state -
fireEvent -
Returns:
boolean

getState

public boolean getState()
Returns the current state (on/off) of the light source as a boolean (on = true, off = false)

Returns:
boolean

turnOn

public void turnOn()
Turns the light source on and sets the intensity to the getMaxIntensity() and fires an event. Returns the new state of the light source (should be on).

turnOn

public void turnOn(boolean fireEvent)
Turns the light source on and determine if you fire an event (true = fire event) to all listeners. Returns the new state of the light source.

turnOff

public boolean turnOff()
Turns the light source off and fires an event. Returns the new state of the light source (should be off)

Returns:
boolean

turnOff

public boolean turnOff(boolean fireEvent)
Turns the light source off and fires an event if argument is set to true. Returns the new state of the light source (should be off)

Returns:
boolean

isOn

public boolean isOn()
Indicates whether the light source is turned on. Returns 'true' when the light source is ON! (This is the reverse of the function isOff())

Returns:
boolean

isOff

public boolean isOff()
Indicates whether the light source is turned off. Returns 'true' when the light source is OFF! (This is the reverse of the function isOn())

Returns:
